result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D. Argiro

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Case Called: 2:03 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
VRCW.
Court questions deft RE: Employment/Income. 
Court denies appointment of Counsel, deft not found indigent.
DATES:
Calendar Call 11/15/2022 @ 1:00 pm 

Branch 2 File.

Adj: 2:09 pm

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Deft appeared; Needs to provide more documentation to SPD; Deft was directed to SPD office and then return to update JA for further scheduling.  Deft did not return.  In court status set with judge.
Status hearing on October 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Calendar call on October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADA Vechinski appears; Deft appears pro se; Offer exchanged; Deft wants to seek counsel; Sent to SPD to apply; Deft did not return and update JA; Per SPD - Deft needs to provide more documentation; CC set for further follow up;

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 2:32 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
Date and time set for a motion to modify bond.
VRCW. 

COURT notes potential conflict.
Defendant does not see it as a conflict and wishes to proceed with today's hearing.
COURT has reviewed motion to modify bond.
Defendant indicates there is a placement schedule already set for the children.
ADA McGarry states objections to bond modification, suggests parties use a 3rd party for child exchanges.
COURT addresses parties.
Defendant is not opposed to a 3rd party for child exchanges.
COURT denies motion to modify bond; suggests Defendant find a neutral 3rd party to nominate and request a new hearing.

ADA McGarry inquires about status of counsel.
Defendant wishes to proceed pro se.
Defendant given waive of counsel form.

Adjourned: 2:49 p.m.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No contact with victim(s): JJS or RJA or their residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:29 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

RJA makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): JJS or RJA or their residence. 
- Prints and photograph. 

BRANCH 2 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 9/20/2022 at 2:00 pm.
